verses.text: O ye children of Benjamin, gather yourselves to flee out of the midst of Jerusalem, and blow the trumpet in Tekoa, and set up a sign of fire in Beth-haccerem: for evil appeareth out of the north, and great destruction.
I have likened the daughter of Zion \add to\add* a comely and delicate \add woman\add*.
The shepherds with their flocks shall come unto her; they shall pitch \add their\add* tents against her round about; they shall feed every one \add in\add* his place.
Prepare ye war against her; arise, and let us go up at noon. Woe unto us! for the day goeth away, for the shadows of the evening are stretched out.
Arise, and let us go by night, and let us destroy her palaces.
For thus hath the \sc Lord\sc* of hosts said, Hew ye down trees, and cast a mount against Jerusalem: this is the city to be visited; she \add is\add* wholly oppression in the midst of her.
As a fountain casteth out her waters, so she casteth out her wickedness: violence and spoil is heard in her; before me continually \add is\add* grief and wounds.
Be thou instructed, O Jerusalem, lest my soul depart from thee; lest I make thee desolate, a land not inhabited.
Thus saith the \sc Lord\sc* of hosts, They shall throughly glean the remnant of Israel as a vine: turn back thine hand as a grapegatherer into the baskets.

To whom shall I speak, and give warning, that they may hear? behold, their ear \add is\add* uncircumcised, and they cannot hearken: behold, the word of the \sc Lord\sc* is unto them a reproach; they have no delight in it.

Therefore I am full \add of\add* the fury of the \sc Lord\sc*; I am weary with holding in: I \add will\add* pour \add it\add* out upon the children abroad, and upon the assembly of young men together: for even the husband with the wife shall be taken, the aged with \add him that is\add* full of days.
And their houses shall be turned unto others, \add with their\add* fields and wives together: for I will stretch out my hand upon the inhabitants of the land, saith the \sc Lord\sc*.
For from the least of them even unto the greatest of them every one \add is\add* given to covetousness; and from the prophet even unto the priest every one dealeth falsely.
They have healed also the hurt of \add the daughter of\add* my people slightly, saying, Peace, peace; when \add there is\add* no peace.

Were they ashamed when they had committed abomination? nay, they were not at all ashamed, neither could they blush: therefore they shall fall among them that fall: at the time \add that\add* I visit them they shall be cast down, saith the \sc Lord\sc*.

Thus saith the \sc Lord\sc*, Stand ye in the ways, and see, and ask for the old paths, where \add is\add* the good way, and walk therein, and ye shall find rest for your souls. But they said, We will not walk \add therein\add*.
Also I set watchmen over you, \add saying\add*, Hearken to the sound of the trumpet. But they said, We will not hearken.
Therefore hear, ye nations, and know, O congregation, what \add is\add* among them.
Hear, O earth: behold, I will bring evil upon this people, \add even\add* the fruit of their thoughts, because they have not hearkened unto my words, nor \add to\add* my law, but rejected it.
To what purpose cometh there to me incense from Sheba, and the sweet cane from a far country? your burnt offerings \add are\add* not acceptable, nor your sacrifices sweet unto me.
Therefore thus saith the \sc Lord\sc*, Behold, I will lay stumblingblocks before this people, and the fathers and the sons together shall fall upon them; the neighbour and his friend shall perish.
Thus saith the \sc Lord\sc*, Behold, a people cometh from the north country, and a great nation shall be raised from the sides of the earth.

They shall lay hold on bow and spear; they \add are\add* cruel, and have no mercy; their voice roareth like the sea; and they ride upon horses, set in array as men for war against thee, O daughter of Zion.
We have heard the fame thereof: our hands wax feeble: anguish hath taken hold of us, \add and\add* pain, as of a woman in travail.
Go not forth \add into\add* the field, nor walk by the way; for the sword of the enemy \add and\add* fear \add is\add* on every side.

O daughter of my people, gird \add thee\add* with sackcloth, and wallow thyself in ashes: make thee mourning, \add as\add* for an only \add son\add*, most bitter lamentation: for the spoiler shall suddenly come upon us.
I have set thee \add for\add* a tower \add and\add* a fortress among my people, that thou mayest know and try their way.
They \add are\add* all grievous revolters, walking with slanders: \add they are\add* brass and iron; they \add are\add* all corrupters.
The bellows are burnt, the lead is consumed of the fire; the founder melteth in vain: for the wicked are not plucked away.
Reprobate silver shall \add men\add* call them, because the \sc Lord\sc* hath rejected them.
